title: Full-body MRI scans may not be as effective as believed to be; know why - The Indian Express
summary:
Full-body MRI scans may not be as effective as believed to be; know why

Date: [Insert publication date]

Source: [Insert source]

Full body MRI scans have surged in popularity, but a new study reveals they may not be as effective for detecting diseases as previously thought.

  • The study, led by Adam Taylor from Lancaster University, analyzed 16,000 brain MRI scans.
  • Findings: MRI scans detected serious conditions in only a small percentage of cases—1.4% for the brain, 1.3% for the chest, and 1.9% for the abdomen.
  • High rates of false positives were reported, with 97 false positives in 1,000 breast scans.
  • Experts agree on the limitations of full-body MRI scans for preventive measures.
  • While they can detect certain abnormalities, many preventable diseases might remain undetected.
“The risk of overdiagnosis and overtreatment is a significant concern.” - Dr. Rahul Gautam

In conclusion, while full-body MRI scans offer insights into certain health conditions, their effectiveness as preventive diagnostics remains controversial due to limitations in detecting various diseases.
newTitle: Effectiveness of Full-Body MRI Scans Questioned by New Study

Singapore Post fires CEO, other senior leaders amid whistleblowing charges | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Singapore Post Dismisses CEO Amid Whistleblower Allegations

Published Date: [Insert Publication Date Here] Source: Bloomberg

Singapore Post Ltd. has terminated its CEO, Vincent Phang, and other senior executives due to allegations of misconduct following a whistleblower report.

Key Points:

  • SingPost launched an investigation after receiving a whistleblower report regarding manual data alterations to avoid contract penalties.
  • Three managers were dismissed, and a police report was filed against them.
  • Phang and other executives were deemed “grossly negligent” and have contested their terminations.
  • SingPost plans to appoint a new CEO and will pay a settlement to the affected customer without impacting its financial results.
“The allegations are without merits, and procedurally unfair,” stated Phang and Yik.

This incident highlights significant challenges in corporate governance at SingPost as it seeks to restore integrity and trust.
newTitle: Singapore Post Dismisses CEO Amid Whistleblower Allegations

Billionaire Anil Agarwal-led mining major Vedanta Limited has revised its proposed demerger plan, now choosing to retain its Base Metals undertaking within the parent firm.

  • Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta has announced a revision in its demerger plan
  • The demerger of the Vedanta Base Metals undertaking will be considered at a later stage
  • The change will not affect the overall value creation as envisioned
“The shareholders will continue to enjoy value unlocking of the Vedanta Base Metals business as part of legacy residual Vedanta...”

The demerger process is expected to conclude in the first quarter of next year, with a favorable dividend policy anticipated.

title: Microfinance mayhem: This MFI ​could have ​‘going concern’ issues | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Microfinance mayhem: This MFI could have ‘going concern’ issues

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Stock Market News

In 2018, Warburg Pincus made a significant investment in the Indian microfinance sector, specifically in Fusion Microfinance Ltd, which went public on November 15, 2022, with shares closing at ₹324. However, by August 2023, the stock had surged to ₹692 per share.

  • Warburg Pincus invested in Fusion Microfinance Ltd in 2018.
  • The company was listed on 15 November 2022, starting at ₹324 per share.
  • The stock peaked at ₹692 in August 2023.
  • Current concerns over Fuson Microfinance’s financial viability have emerged.
“Investors are worried about the potential 'going concern' issues related to microfinance institutions.”

The unfolding situation suggests a deeper scrutiny of microfinance viability, particularly as market conditions fluctuate.
newTitle: Microfinance Mayhem: Concerns Rise Over Fusion Microfinance's Viability

summary:
Earnings Growth Slowdown Seen as Temporary by Franklin Templeton's Hari Shyamsunder

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Live Mint

Hari Shyamsunder of Franklin Templeton discusses the implications of recent corporate earnings trends, suggesting that the current slowdown is likely temporary and that a recovery is on the horizon.

  • Government spending is expected to align with nominal GDP growth.
  • Private capital expenditure is predicted to increase in the next 3-5 years due to higher capacity utilization.
  • Emerging sectors like renewables and electric vehicles will see an uptick in investments.
  • A recovery in corporate earnings is anticipated in the second half of FY25.
  • Increased rural demand will benefit related companies.
“The slowdown in corporate earnings in the second quarter ended September was temporary. A recovery is likely in the second half of FY25.”

This perspective highlights optimism for future growth amid current economic challenges.
newTitle: Earnings Growth Slowdown Seen as Temporary by Franklin Templeton's Hari Shyamsunder

title: How much do dark matter particles weigh? - The Hindu
summary:
How Much Do Dark Matter Particles Weigh?

Date: December 23, 2024 Source: The Hindu

A significant update has emerged in the understanding of dark matter, suggesting that the minimum mass of dark matter particles is now revised to 2.3 × 10-30 proton masses, impacting current theories in cosmology.

  • Dark matter is an invisible substance that makes up five-sixths of the universe's matter.
  • Previous assumptions estimated the minimum mass of dark matter particles to be about 10-31 times that of a proton.
  • Recent research indicates the need for heavier particles to better explain the observations from the Leo II dwarf galaxy.
  • Understanding dark matter's distribution could allow it to affect structures at different scales.
“It’s not everyday that particle physics gets to redraw a fundamental goal post by an order of magnitude.” - Nirmal Raj

This finding not only reshapes existing theories regarding dark matter but also emphasizes the evolving nature of scientific inquiry, reflecting a critical advancement achieved through computational methods.
newTitle: How Much Do Dark Matter Particles Weigh?

title: Pushpa 2 Box Office Day 18 Ticket Sales: Allu Arjun Beasts With 44% More Sold Tix Than Stree 2 On 3rd Sunday! - Koimoi

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 Source: Koimoi

Pushpa 2 has been raging at the box office with phenomenal numbers over the third weekend. The ticket sales are proof that the film would not surrender even during the upcoming week, having already surpassed every single film of 2024 in terms of ticket sales!

  • On the 3rd Sunday, Stree 2 registered a ticket sale of 305K.
  • Pushpa 2 registered an estimated ticket sale of 440K on the same day, almost 44% higher than Stree 2.
  • Pushpa 2 peaked at 37K ticket sales per hour.
  • Total ticket sales reached 17.5 million by December 22.
“It would be interesting to see where Pushpa 2’s journey ends with its ticket sales on BMS, setting a new record for the upcoming films!”

In conclusion, Pushpa 2 continues to dominate box office sales, showcasing the film's popularity and strong performance in ticket sales.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Box Office Day 18 Ticket Sales: Allu Arjun Leads with 44% More Tickets Sold than Stree 2

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will distribute more than 71,000 appointment letters to new recruits in various Union government departments on December 23, 2024, via videoconferencing.

  • The Rozgar Mela aims to prioritize employment generation.
  • Distribution of appointment letters will begin at approximately 10:30 am.

Champions Trophy: India vs Pakistan on February 23 in UAE

India will play their Champions Trophy 2025 matches in the UAE with a notable match against Pakistan scheduled for February 23.

  • The PCB has chosen the UAE as a neutral venue for the tournament.
  • India's group includes Pakistan, Bangladesh, and New Zealand.
  • India will face Bangladesh on February 20 and New Zealand on March 2.
  • The tournament starts on February 19, with Pakistan facing New Zealand in Karachi.
  • Knockout matches including semi-finals and finals may shift venues based on India's progression.
  • This arrangement is part of a hybrid model agreement between India and Pakistan for future ICC events.
“The PCB has picked the UAE as a neutral venue for the Champions Trophy,” said PCB spokesperson Amir Mir.

In conclusion, the Champions Trophy will showcase India and Pakistan in a significant match amidst a hybrid model designed to accommodate both nations in upcoming ICC events.

summary:
Epigamia co-founder Rohan Mirchandani dies at 42

Date: [Publication_date_here] Source: [Source_name_here]

Rohan Mirchandani, the co-founder of popular yogurt brand Epigamia, has passed away at the age of 42, leaving behind a legacy of innovation in the food industry.

  • Mirchandani played a pivotal role in launching Epigamia, which became one of India’s leading yogurt brands.
  • He was known for his vision and dedication to promoting health-conscious food options.
  • The loss is felt deeply within the community, and tributes have poured in for his contributions to the industry.
“He was a true innovator and guided Epigamia to great heights,” said a close colleague.

The tragic passing of Rohan Mirchandani highlights the impact of his work and the void left in the food and entrepreneurial community.

title: Farmers push for SC’s help after parliamentary standing committee backs MSP law - Hindustan Times
summary:
Farmers Urge Supreme Court to Implement MSP Law After Committee's Support

Date: Dec 23, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Farmers, led by Jagjit Singh Dallewal, are calling on the Supreme Court to enforce the parliamentary committee's recommendation for a legally guaranteed minimum support price (MSP) for farm produce.

  • Dallewal is on a fast-unto-death to push for the implementation of the MSP law.
  • The parliamentary standing committee has emphasized the need for legally guaranteed MSPs for farmers.
  • The report suggests the agriculture ministry should create a roadmap for implementing MSP.
  • MSPs are intended to provide a minimum price to prevent distress sales among farmers.
  • The committee's report discusses the advantages of implementing MSP as a legal guarantee to enhance rural economic growth.
  • If not implemented, the government must provide a formal explanation to the committee.
“Implementing a legally binding MSP in India is essential not only for safeguarding farmers’ livelihoods but also for promoting rural economic growth.”

In conclusion, the farmers' plea, supported by the parliamentary committee, highlights the critical need for legal guarantees to ensure fair compensation for farmers’ produce, which could lead to sustainable farming practices.
newTitle: Farmers Urge Supreme Court to Implement MSP Law After Committee's Support

  • All matches are likely to be held in Dubai.
  • The final is set for March 9 in Lahore, with a reserve day.
“The PCB has picked the UAE as a neutral venue for the Champions Trophy,” - Amir Mir, PCB spokesperson.

This decision is part of a hybrid model agreement that ensures neutral venues for certain matches, especially for significant tournaments leading up to 2028.

title: Low Bounce, Nothing For Pacers On Practice Pitches: India Train On ‘Flat Tracks’ For Boxing Day Test | Repo - News18
summary:
India Faces Challenges on Flat Practice Pitches Ahead of Boxing Day Test

Date: December 22, 2024 21:57 IST Source: Times of India

The Indian cricket team is encountering difficulties with the practice pitches at the MCG, leading into the Boxing Day Test. Unlike the conditions expected, the pitches are reported to have lower bounce, which hampers the effectiveness of fast bowlers.

  • Practice pitches at the MCG described as having 'lower bounce' and 'absolutely nothing' for the pace attack.
  • India's quick bowlers struggled to find assistance during the practice session.
  • Australian team has not yet begun their training and may use different pitch conditions.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma faced an injury scare during practice, but it is believed to be minor.
“The Indian captain removed his gear, settled into a chair, and the physio got the ice pack out,” Times of India reported.

The upcoming Boxing Day Test will be crucial for India as they navigate the challenges posed by the pitch conditions and player health.
newTitle: India Faces Challenges on Flat Practice Pitches Ahead of Boxing Day Test
